entry.title: Revert "[CodeHealth] Remove dangling pointer in WebContentsModalDialogManager"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 8eed9f40e5894cefaa730b6c21ce42e5c3155425.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the culprit of a build failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/compile-analysis/b/8757783807200730017



Sample failed build: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8757783807200730017



If this is a false positive, please report it at https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/entry?comment=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fci.chromium.org%2Fui%2Fp%2Fchromium%2Fbisection%2Fcompile-analysis%2Fb%2F8757783807200730017&components=Tools%3ETest%3EFindit&labels=LUCI-Bisection-Wrong%2CPri-3%2CType-Bug&status=Available&summary=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F5142391



Original change's description:

> [CodeHealth] Remove dangling pointer in WebContentsModalDialogManager

>

> Clean up the delegate in a few places by setting it to nullptr before

> destruction. The locations needing cleanup were identified by a

> combination of bot failures after removing the annotation and code

> search for callers of SetDelegate() that called this only once and did

> not call SetDelegate() again with a nullptr argument.

>

entry.title: Speculative fix for failed DecomposeMatrix
entry.content:
We're seeing a few crash dumps due to a DecomposeMatrix call. From the

user report, this is likely specific to the bounded reference space.

Debugging reveals that the matrix looks to be full of NaN values, and

that likely the existing DCHECK would've tripped were it enabled. Since

we aren't sure of this source of these values, this change adds two

separate validations that the matrix is valid with a followup planned in

6 months via Issue 1522245.



This also promotes the presumed skipped DCHECK to a CHECK at roughly the

same time as the DumpWithoutCrashing calls should be evaluated.



I've also filed Issue 1522273 to track a better usage pattern for the

transforms.



Fixed: 1522242

Change-Id: I18992e0e7f77c9f75b0b00936981c62b0d62cbeb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5241665

Commit-Queue: Daniel Cheng

Reviewed-by: Piotr Bialecki

Auto-Submit: Alexander Cooper

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Commit-Queue: Alexander Cooper

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1252974}

entry.content:
This change adds a delay before the window splitting phantom window

shows up. Also, the cursor needs to be moving slow enough for the delay

timer to start, which should prevent the phantom window from

unintentionally showing up when the user is trying to drag a window

across the screen.

entry.title: [Win-a11y] Fix incorrect bounding rect in web content
entry.content:
On all platforms, the accessible nodes coming from web content compute

their bounding rectangle in screen physical coordinates by scaling the

bounds it gets in screen DIPs from the window by the device scale factor.

This is incorrect on Windows.



On Windows, we must use the display::win::ScreenWin::DIPToScreenRect

function to apply correctly the device scale factor. This is what we're

already doing for accessible node coming from Views, and what we're

doing essentially everywhere we need to send a rect or a point to a

Windows API, like in the TSF Store. We just weren't doing the same for

accessible nodes coming from web content.



My understanding of why we can't perform a plain DSF scale operation on

Windows is limited, but here's what I got from debugging the area:



* Windows first sends the display information to Chromium. At this

point, we have what I think we call "screen pixels" coordinates.

I'll call them Windows-POV-screen-physical-coordinates here.

* Windows has been historically bad at handling set ups of multiple

monitors of different DPI, so we run our own logic to ensure Chromium

renders correctly on every monitor. This leads us to create our own

internal representation of the screen physical coordinates, which

I'll call chromium-POV-screen-physical-coordinates.

* There's no simple algebraic relation between the Windows-POV and

Chromium-POV screen physical coordinates like there is between

Screen DIPs and Screen physical on other platforms.

* For that reason, we always have to use the ScreenWin helper

functions to jump from internal Screen DIPS to the screen physical

coordinated Windows actually expect.



Bug: 1521965

Change-Id: I64d5974aa77582c5d4c8c11ad4f2a01b544ec699

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5239465

Auto-Submit: Benjamin Beaudry

Commit-Queue: Benjamin Beaudry

Reviewed-by: Kurt Catti-Schmidt

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1252972}

entry.title: extensions: Add support for executeScript() with a file parameter
entry.content:
Previous work in this area added a ControlledFrameEmbedderURLFetcher.

This change updates the WebView internal API to use that fetcher for the

one-off handling present in the executeScript() call's support of the

'file' parameter.



Since WebViewInternalInsertCSSFunction is based on

WebViewInternalExecuteCodeFunction, these changes also add support for

the insertCSS() call to use a 'file' parameter.



As part of this work, move the LoadFileCallback to URLFetcher so it can

be used by both WebUIURLFetcher and ControlledFrameEmbedderURLFetcher.



Added tests which cover executeScript() in both the 'code' and 'file'

cases.

entry.title: Multiplanar: Remove HalfFloatMaker for consistency with multiplanar SI
entry.content:
With multiplanar shared images, we create a TextureDrawQuad instead of

YuvVideoDrawQuad from VideoResourceUpdater. These texture draw quads

don't take resource multiplier, offset which yuv draw quad use for

color space conversion filtering which is done through skia with

multiplanar shared images. Thus, this change removes HalfFloatMaker

such that we always pass multiplier(1) and offset(0) and go through

libyuv conversion for simplicity. This is similar to how

GpuMemoryBufferVideoFramePool handles for copying buffers [1]



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/video/gpu_memory_buffer_video_frame_pool.cc;l=527



Bug: 1414555

entry.title: v4l2/stateless: Correct VideoFrame plane sizes
entry.content:
|GenericDmaBufVideoFrameMapper::Map| needs the correct plane

size in order to correctly map the buffers for reading.



VIDIOC_S_FMT was expected to return the correct plane size.

Instead it is returning the plane size for an 8 bit format only.



VIDIOC_QUERYBUF does provide the correct plane size that

each buffer takes up.

entry.title: Switch AutoSizeLazyLoadedImages back to experimental
entry.content:
This change switches the AutoSizeLazyLoadedImages flag back to

experimental because of several bug reports for M121:

https://crbug.com/1521479

https://crbug.com/1522175

https://crbug.com/1522116

https://crbug.com/1522027



The issues reported are because of the change to auto sizes img

UA style rules defined in:

https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#img-contain-size



That was checked in with:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5050963



Since several sites seem to be using `size=auto` without defining width

and height attributes for images, the UA style rule is applied causing

the images to not render as expected. To avoid this the UA style rule is reverted as well.



There is a note mentioned in the html spec addressing this:

https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#sizes-attributes

"In addition, it is strongly encouraged to specify dimensions using the

width and height attributes or with CSS. Without specified dimensions,

the image will likely render with 300x150 dimensions because

sizes="auto" implies contain-intrinsic-size: 300px 150px in the

Rendering section."



R=szager



Bug: 1522175

Change-Id: I5b4d04b0660528999196e5387beac2c3d63df277

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5241231

Reviewed-by: Stefan Zager

entry.title: Created compat class for FullscreenHtmlApiHandler
entry.content:
FullscreenHtmlApiHandler has been using deprecated Android APIs to enter/exit fullscreen, this creates a compat class that uses the new APIs when possible. Migration from the legacy class that only uses the deprecated logic will be controlled by the flag FULLSCREEN_INSETS_API_MIGRATION.



Note that this migration also allows automotive devices to hide the system bars when entering full screen mode.

entry.title: Add more tests for App Bound encryption.
entry.content:
In preparation for adding more protection levels, this CL adds

a new testing capability where app-bound encryption can be

called from a specified child process.



In a new test, the child process name is configured in order

to test ProtectionLevel::PATH_VALIDATION, but future CLs will

add additional capabilities to configure other attributes of

the test executable.



This CL also moves the tests into the os_crypt namespace.



It continues to run them as interactive_ui_tests rather than

in a unit test or normal browser test, because the service

management requires the tests to be run sequentially and never

concurrently, which interactive_ui_tests guarantees.



BUG=1333461



Change-Id: I9ed45f3495aa0ec553d5b878eb2432f276dd3dc9

entry.title: media/gpu: Add rotation and crop support for VulkanImageProcessor
entry.content:
Add rotation and crop support for VulkanImageProcessor. The display

controllers on certain SoCs don't support rotation, so this will need to

be handled by the VulkanImageProcessor. While crop can be implemented in

display controllers by adjusting offset and size parameters, it's a

waste of GPU time to render regions of the frame that will never be

scanned out.



Bug: b:251458823

image_processor_unit_test_vulkan Tast test.

entry.title: [Nearby Presence] Enable Bluetooth Classic scanning flag
entry.content:
Adds the feature flag to control Bluetooth Classic scanning. Tested via

unit tests and manually with BLE V2 enabled/disabled. When BLE V2

is disabled, we are only able to discover share targets that are

contacts when Classic scanning is disabled (WAI). When BLE V2 is

enabled and Classic scanning is disabled, we fail to discover (WAI)

as we haven't hooked up BLE Scanning properly yet.



Test: Tested manually with the flag enabled/disabled.

Bug: b/319517542

entry.title: media/gpu/iptest: Add mode to force a particular IP backend
entry.content:
This is useful for locally testing the VAAPI and V4L2 image processors.

It is not used by any tast test, but could be.



If the backend is forced, then the Vulkan and MM21 comparison tests are

skipped.



Also, if the backend is forced, but the forced backend does not support

the test's port configuration, then the test is skipped. This happens by

checking the return value of the ImageProcessorBackend Create function.

If it returns nullptr for a forced backend, then the test is skipped.



Bug: None

Test: Tests pass without the "force backend" arguments.

Test: Tests produce results with the backend forced.

entry.title: Introduce URLLoaderFactoryBuilder
entry.content:
To clarify and centralize the `URLLoaderFactory` composition

for better understanding and further cleanup/optimization,

this CL introduces `URLLoaderFactoryBuilder` and

passes `URLLoaderFactoryBuilder&` in navigational

`URLLoaderFactory` composition

(`WillCreateURLLoaderFactory` etc.) instead of

`mojo::PendingReceiver*`.



Design doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1oN3vkIgs76-KUO00rLTgYfploKz7MpDPBqgUUzxWupE/edit?usp=sharing



This CL also removes `use_proxy` bool where possible, as

`URLLoaderFactoryBuilder` knows whether there are

intercepters and doesn't need to check `use_proxy`.



Bug: 1506871

entry.title: ipcz: Fix a few weak asserts
entry.content:
DriverMemory cloning should not weakly assert success, as it can fail in

real production scenarios. Now Clone() will return an invalid

DriverMemory object if it fails to duplicate the internal handle.

Existing callers of Clone() are already durable to an invalid output, so

this change results in graceful failures instead of undefined behavior.



This also replaces some weak asserts in DriverTransport creation with

hardening asserts. We may want to fail more gracefully if these end

up crashing a lot, but it seems unlikely.



Fixed: 1521571

Change-Id: Id764b33ead8bbba58e61b3270920c839479eaa4a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5240312

Commit-Queue: Ken Rockot

Reviewed-by: Alex Gough

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1252882}

entry.title: printing: Fix media_col sizes sent to CUPS
entry.content:
Print preview expects media sizes to be in portrait (height greater than

the width). Media sizes that have a width greater than the height will

get swapped to match the portrait expectation. However, CUPS is

expecting the media_col entry to be in the original format.



When generating the IPP attributes to send to CUPS, check to see if the

media size was swapped by looking at the vendor ID (which does not get

altered). Swap the media size back if needed and generate the

appropriate media_col entry to send to CUPS.



Bug: b:297121018

entry.title: Reland "[DTC] Use TabObscuringHandler to block transition"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 0e360944c85585de4986db7ea887b0a32f562eb4.



Reason for revert: Remove the modal dialog changes from the CL and attempt to run CQ for testing



Original change's description:

> Revert "[DTC] Use TabObscuringHandler to block transition"

>

> This reverts commit 17af365cc1377f9911a0da267cfa206edf4d218e.

>

> Reason for revert:

> LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the cause of a test failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/5650509283196928

>

> Sample build with failed test: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8757886409186917665

> Affected test(s):

> [ninja://chrome/android:monochrome_public_test_ar_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.vr.WebXrArAnchorsTest#testAnchorStates__ChromeTabbedActivity](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Fandroid:monochrome_public_test_ar_apk%2Forg.chromium.chrome.browser.vr.WebXrArAnchorsTest%23testAnchorStates__ChromeTabbedActivity?q=VHash%3A0997725764c6d359)

> [ninja://chrome/android:monochrome_public_test_ar_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.vr.WebXrArAnchorsTest#testAnchorStates__CustomTabActivity](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Fandroid:monochrome_public_test_ar_apk%2Forg.chromium.chrome.browser.vr.WebXrArAnchorsTest%23testAnchorStates__CustomTabActivity?q=VHash%3A0997725764c6d359)

> [ninja://chrome/android:monochrome_public_test_ar_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.vr.WebXrArHitTestTest#testHitTestCancellationWorks__CustomTabActivity](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Fandroid:monochrome_public_test_ar_apk%2Forg.chromium.chrome.browser.vr.WebXrArHitTestTest%23testHitTestCancellationWorks__CustomTabActivity?q=VHash%3A0997725764c6d359)

> [ninja://chrome/android:monochrome_public_test_ar_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.vr.WebXrArHitTestTest#testHitTestResultsAvailableInSubsequentFrame__ChromeTabbedActivity](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Fandroid:monochrome_public_test_ar_apk%2Forg.chromium.chrome.browser.vr.WebXrArHitTestTest%23testHitTestResultsAvailableInSubsequentFrame__ChromeTabbedActivity?q=VHash%3A0997725764c6d359)

> [ninja://chrome/android:monochrome_public_test_ar_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.vr.WebXrArHitTestTest#testHitTestResultsAvailableInSubsequentFrame__CustomTabActivity](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Fandroid:monochrome_public_test_ar_apk%2Forg.chromium.chrome.browser.vr.WebXrArHitTestTest%23testHitTestResultsAvailableInSubsequentFrame__CustomTabActivity?q=VHash%3A0997725764c6d359)

> and 9 more ...

>

> If this is a false positive, please report it at http://b.corp.google.com/createIssue?component=1199205&description=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fci.chromium.org%2Fui%2Fp%2Fchromium%2Fbisection%2Ftest-analysis%2Fb%2F5650509283196928&format=PLAIN&priority=P3&title=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F5234482&type=BUG

>

> Original change's description:

> > [DTC] Use TabObscuringHandler to block transition

> >

> > When tab strip transition happens when a scrim overs only the portion under the toolbar, there'll be a gap / overlap between the scrim to the toolbar. For those cases, tab strip transition should be blocked.

> >

> > TabObscuringHandler is used by several other component to indicate the tab content is blocked by some other UI e.g. TabModalDialog. This CL makes TabStripTransitionCoordinator listen to that signal to decide whether to kick off an transition.

> >

> > This CL also changed the timing when tab modal dialog calls #unobscur, from as soon as the dialog is dismissed, to until the exit animation is completed. This aligns with what's being done in the ScrimMediator i.e. only trigger visibility callback once scrim has alpha=0.

> >

> > Bug: 1519696

entry.title: [Fast Pair][Software Scanning] HardwareOffloadingSupportedProvider
entry.content:
Create the HardwareOffloadingSupportedProvider class. This provider

retrieves a pointer to an adapter object and determines whether

the device supports offloading bluetooth scanning onto its hardware.



Note that the HardwareOffloadingSupportedProvider ctor assumes that

it will receive an adapter object from BluetoothAdapterFactory::Get().

Comments above this function note that it will not return without an

initialized adapter object; for this reason, the circumstance where

the received pointer to the adapter is null is not tested, though

the pointer's validity is still tested before accessing member functions

in the HardwareOffloadingSupportedProvider.



The FakeBluetoothAdapter class is changed to better mock the

BluetoothAdapter class: on a change to status as 'present', it

notifies its observer of this change. A redundant function,

NotifyPoweredChanged, is deleted as well.



this, pass.



Tested: all unit tests in ash_unittests, including those written in

Fixed: b/322223967

entry.title: Fix race condition in MakeIterable()
entry.content:
Basically, you can iterate through the objects in persistent memory.

The function to make an object iterable (MakeIterable()) has an early

exit case if the object is already iterable. But it's racy if two

threads are trying to make the same object iterable.



In particular, the current code looks like:

```

if (block->next.load(std::memory_order_acquire) != 0)

return; // Already iterable.

block->next.store(kReferenceQueue, std::memory_order_release);

```



If block->next is 0, that means it was not made iterable yet. To

indicate that we are making it iterable, we set block->next to

kReferenceQueue which is a "dummy value" representing the end of the

linkedlist queue of iterable objects. However, doing so might

overwrite the work that another thread did, basically cutting the

linkedlist early, and some objects that were iterable are now "lost".



For example, let's say a thread is making object "A" iterable, but

context switches after the if check.

Then, another thread makes A iterable, and also makes some other

objects iterable. I.e., the linkedlist will look like:

head -> A -> B -> C -> kReferenceQueue (null).

Now, after the first thread resumes and completes, the queue will look

like:

head -> A -> kReferenceQueue (null) B -> C -> kReferenceQueue (null).

Note that objects B and C are not part of the linkedlist anymore.



Demo of the race condition:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5237775



This fixes it by doing the whole thing in one operation instead

(compare-and-swap).



Found this while investigating the various NOTREACHED() in persistent

memory code. The window for this race condition is quite small, and I

doubt it happens in prod (it requires two different threads trying to

make the same object iterable, which I don't think happens, but I

haven't looked in-depth). So I don't think it's related to the

various NOTREACHED()s.



Bug: 1432981

Change-Id: Ibfa38970371b3d10755d6d2256c2bfe733de3013

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5238211

Reviewed-by: Alexei Svitkine

Commit-Queue: Luc Nguyen

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1252846}

entry.title: [Build] Fix build with use_sysroot=false
entry.content:
In [1], I changed system headers to use -I instead of -isystem

so that deps files would be generated for system headers. This was

required since the build uses -MMD. Without the deps files, updates

to system headers won't trigger a rebuild.



However, this was the incorrect solution since we still want to use

-isystem to avoid custom Chromium checks (like no raw pointers in

structs) for system headers. This CL switches back to -isystem in

all cases, and uses -MD instead of -MMD which will generate deps

files for system headers as well.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1159689



R=thestig



Change-Id: If1197a67b5300dc8e41cb950fe779a1cc0c79da1

entry.title: [Android TRM] Add suggestions computation pipeline.
entry.content:
This CL integrates various Tab Resumption Module parts to establish the

pipeline to fetch and compute suggestions.

* New properties:

* Below are injected from mayCreateTabResumptionModuleCoordinator(),

and are fixed throughout the lifetime of the TRM:

* DATA_PROVIDER: TabResumptionDataProvider instance

* URL_IMAGE_PROVIDER: UrlImageProvider instance.

* CLICK_CALLBACK: Handler for tile click, set to open new tabs.

* SUGGESTION_BUNDLE: Computed SuggestionBundle instance, cached to

enable restoration for future RecyclerView usage.

* Setting this triggers render (implemented in follow-up CLs), which

also affects IS_VISIBLE (null -> hide the TRM).

* Mediator:

* Add getCurrentTimeMs(): Using method to testing override.

* Add isSuggestionValid(): Filters suggestion, currently only rejects

those with empty titles, but extendable for URL-based filtering.

* Add makeSuggestionBundle(): Takes ranked suggestion, applies filter,

limit to MAX_TILES_NUMBER = 2 suggestions, returns SuggestionBundle.

* Add reload() (formerly start()): Fetch data, make SuggestionBundle,

writes SUGGESTION_BUNDLE property.

* Coordinator:

* Add to own (data and image) provider instances, injected from CTOR.

* Binds data provider to call reload() on status change, so that the

TRM hides if user logs out or disables sync.

* Wraps suggestion click callback (preparing for metric injection),

passed to Mediator.

* Note: reload() is not called from CTOR, so the unit test can

instantiate the Coordinator in setUp(), do per-test initialization,

then call reload() to trigger flow.

* TabResumptionModuleUtils.mayCreateTabResumptionModuleCoordinator():

* Passed to new Coordinator to own:

* New ForeignSessionTabResumptionDataProvider, subject to change

once we also consider local tabs.

* New UrlImageProvider.

* Explicitly call Coordinator reload() to initialize.

* Add TODOs to metrics tracking code sites.



Also populate TabResumptionModuleMediatorUnitTest with 4 tests.

* The Mediator is not even stored as a variable; the test instantiates

Coordinator directly. However, the test refers to Mediator since the

emphasis is on the pre-View business logic.



Bug: 1515325

entry.content:
The SafeBrowsingBlockingPageHashRealTimeCheckTest tests were previously

parametrized to run both async checks enabled and disabled. However,

that caused flaky failures when the async check had not finished by the

time the page loaded.



This CL re-parametrizes these test cases and also modifies the tests so

that they wait for any pending async checks to complete.



The TriggerHitReportAndClientSafeBrowsingReportRequest still only runs

for the async checks disabled case because it has other flaky failures

entry.title: Rename {absl => std}::optional in //components/
entry.content:
#cleanup



Automated patch. This is a no-op. Please avoid, to assign unrelated

bugs to this, as much as possible.



Context:

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/cxx/c/nBD_1LaanTc/m/ghh-ZZhWAwAJ?utm_medium=email



As of https://crrev.com/1204351, absl::optional is now a type alias

for std::optional. We should migrate toward it.



Script:

```

function replace {

echo "Replacing $1 by $2"

git grep -l "$1" \

| cut -f1 -d: \

| grep \

-e "^components/" \

| grep \

-e "\.h" \

-e "\.cc" \

-e "\.mm" \

| grep -v \

-e "components/cast_streaming/browser/public/receiver_config.*" \

-e "components/power_metrics/*" \

-e "components/zucchini/patch_reader.*" \

| sort \

| uniq \

| xargs sed -i "s/$1/$2/g"

}

replace "absl::make_optional" "std::make_optional"

replace "absl::optional" "std::optional"

replace "absl::nullopt" "std::nullopt"

replace "absl::in_place" "std::in_place"

replace "absl::in_place_t" "std::in_place_t"

replace "\"third_party\/abseil-cpp\/absl\/types\/optional.h\"" ""



echo "Formatting:"



echo "IncludeBlocks: Regroup" >> ".clang-format"

echo "IncludeIsMainRegex: \"(_(android|apple|chromeos|freebsd|fuchsia|fuzzer|ios|linux|mac|nacl|openbsd|posix|stubs?|win))?(_(unit|browser|perf)?tests?)?$\"" >> ".clang-format"

git cl format

git restore ".clang-format"



git cl format

```



Bug: chromium:1500249

Change-Id: I34b45aba082a627d94fd9d3f9f994a60c64b40b1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5200092

Auto-Submit: Arthur Sonzogni

entry.title: [import-attributes] Only run WPT tests relying on `with` in the attributes virtual suite
entry.content:
Multiple WPT tests related to JSON and CSS modules are failing because

they rely on the `with` import attributes syntax, which is currently

disabled by default.



This patch marks them to only be run as part of the

`import-attributes-json-css-modules` virtual test suite, which enables

the `--harmony-import-attributes` flag, so that unflagging the syntax in

V8 (done in Ifc5af7f33aabfa0a2d5cd6c8381561848adbe392, blocked on this

patch) will not cause the tests to suddenly pass breaking the current

test expectations.



Note that for all the tests in

`wpt/html/semantics/scripting-1/the-script-element/css-module` and in

`wpt/html/semantics/scripting-1/the-script-element/json-module` there

are equivalent tests in the `css-module-assertions` and

`json-module-assertions` folders, using the `assert` syntax which is

currently enabled by default. The new expected failures for these tests

in the virtual test suite match the expected failures for the

`assert`-based tests.



Bug: v8:13856

entry.title: [infa] Add a node type for target mappings.
entry.content:
The _TARGET_BINARY node type currently represents 2 things: an entry to

be generated in gn_isolate_map.pyl and a valid reference that can be set

as the binary argument for gtests and isolated script tests. However,

not all such references actually make sense since a "binary" with type

"additional_compile_target" can't be used as the binary for a test. This

separates the 2 responsibilities into separate node types so that the

compatibility is enforced by the existence of nodes rather than

requiring additional code to check.

entry.title: [omnibox][grouping] Fixes DCHECK when verifying SideType of Groups in Sections.
entry.content:
A Section verifies at construction time whether the `Group`s in it have

the same SideType (Primary/Secondary) as well as the `GroupId`s in a

given `Group` have the same RenderType (Horizontal/Vertical).



It is possible that Chrome may allow a Secondary SideType `GroupId` that

the server does not always provide in its response. This can result in

a DCHECK because the default instance of omnibox::GroupConfig returned

from looking up omnibox::GroupConfigMap will have the default Primary

SideType. This is fixed by skipping `GroupId`s that are not present in

omnibox::GroupConfigMap when performing that check.



Perhaps these checks can be improved in the future by making sure a

`Section` only permits matches of the expected SideType and a `Group`

only permits matches of the expected RenderType.



This CL also makes some cosmetic changes to make the tests more readable.

entry.title: [DFM] Make build-id 4-byte aligned
entry.content:
The crash team found that the build-id for DFM is not correctly

recognized because it is 1-byte aligned instead of 4-byte aligned.



This CL changes the script so that the build-id in output elf file is

4-byte aligned.

entry.title: [dPWA] Adding telemetry for pwa instanced system media controls
entry.content:
We need this change to add collection for basic telemetry for monitoring this feature's health and usage.



This change adds telemetry for instanced web app system media controls

interactions. Specifically it measures, when a PWA begins to play media

and instanced web app controls are enabled. It also measures when

OS based controls are used to control a web app under the instanced

web app controls system.

entry.title: [wpt] Don't construct unnecessary promises in `open-close.https.html`
entry.content:
When testing `MIDIInput.{open,close}`, `portPromise` and `accessPromise`

in `checkStateTransition()` are still constructed but not awaited.

Because `open-close.https.html` doesn't pass `access`, the latter is an

unhandled rejection that `chromedriver` detects when running the test

against `chrome` (`content_shell` seems to pass the test anyway).



Only construct the promises if needed. Also, machine-check a

precondition.



Bug: 1499775

Change-Id: I587fec95efd92d2be2733b38e0f65a0c361f5c9b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5239869

Auto-Submit: Jonathan Lee

Reviewed-by: Michael Wilson

Commit-Queue: Michael Wilson

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1252797}

entry.title: jni_zero: Preparing for jni_zero to no longer depend on base
entry.content:
Soon, jni_zero's generated files will no longer have a dep onto base's

jni_android.h, which will break a number of files which rely on that

include to provide the base:: aliases to jni_zero functions. For the

most part, I have just changed the base::android:: refs to jni_zero::,

and in a few files with different references I've just added a direct

include of jni_android.h (or whatever header file was needed).



Bug: 1377351
